lines.text: Money, pardon the expression, is like manure. It's not worth a thing unless it's spread around, encouraging young things to grow.
Eighty percent of the people in the world are fools and the rest of us are in danger of contamination.
You'll have to sit still, Mr Vandergelder. If I cut your throat it'll be practically unintentional.
Hello! Hello there, how are you? Oh Hello!
You know too many people.
Total strangers!
Then why do you greet them?
It makes me feel good to have so many friends.
Oh, say hello for me too then.
I already did.
But if I can't marry Ambrose, I know I'll die!
Of what?
A broken heart.
Never heard of it.
Here, let me cut your wings!
I don't want my wings cut!
No man does, Horace, no man does.
Holy cabooses!
700 men.
And on those cold winter nights, Horace, you can snuggle up to your cash register. It's a little lumpy, but it rings!
Where to, Dolly?
Yonkers, New York, to handle a highly personal matter for Mr. Horace Vandergelder, the well-known, unmarried, half-a-millionaire.
Gonna marry him yourself, Dolly?
Why, Mr. Sullivan, what ever put such a preposterous idea into my head... er, your head!
Goodness, the whole room is crawling with men. Irene, my dear, congratulations.

[infatuated with Irene]
Well, you see, we're two ladies about town and we're looking for a had to Malloy and...
We're hats, you see, and we're looking for a lady to Malloy with for the af...

[signals Barnaby to be quiet]
We want a hat!
Look, I'm dancing!
[carelessly backs into a chair and falls]
Uh, I was.
Smile Barnaby.

[forcing a smile]
I'm smiling.
Look rich, gay, and charming.

[a small beat]
I'm looking gay and charming.
Any man who goes to a big city deserves what happens to him.
Barnaby, you don't know anything about women.
Only that we can't afford them.
Advice is cheap, Ms. Molloy. It's the things that come gift wrapped that count!
It takes a woman all powdered and pink to joyously clean out the drain in the sink!
We're gonna close the store.
Close the store?
We have to, 'cause some rotten cans of chicken mash are going to explode.
Holy cabooses, how do you know?
Because I'm gonna light some candles under them.

[singing]
It takes a woman to quietly plan to take him and change him to her kind of man and to gently lead him where fortune can find him and not let him know that the power behind him was that dainty woman, that fragile woman, that sweetheart, that mistress, that wife.
As my late husband, Ephraim Levi, used to say, 'If you have to live from hand-to-mouth, you'd better be ambidextrous.'
This doesn't concern her!
Mr. Kemper, everything concerns Dolly Levi!
You are a seven-foot-tall nincompoop!
That's an insult!
All the facts about you are insults!
Do get done with that, Minnie. The men are eyeing us for the wrong reasons.
A banana a day keeps the doctor away.
You mean an apple a day.
Who ever heard of a doctor slipping on an apple peel?
No expression. Let the food smile.
Minnie, I don't mind that you never finish your lunch, but I do mind that you never finish your sentences.
What's this? A return from Miss Mortimer again?
Same old story, cherries and feathers, cherries and feathers. To catch a beau I suppose.
If you ask me, she'd do better with a heavy veil.
my job, my future, everything people *think* is important, but I don't care - because even if I have to dig ditches for the rest of my life, I shall be a ditch-digger who once had a wonderful day.

[dressed as Ernestina Simple]
What do you mean, oysters aren't *in season*? Anyone can have oysters *in season*, I want them out of season!
They don't have any Miss Simple.
Then tell them to go out and dig for some!
Mr. Kemper, do you mind if we go inside? I'm feeling an updraft in my underpants!
Cornelius Hackl here.
Barnaby Tucker here.
Irene Malloy here.
Mrs. Malloy, I shan't bother you again. And I hope vice versa.
Dolly Levi, you are a damned exasperating woman.
Why Horace Vandergelder. That is the nicest thing you have ever said to me. Ha ha.
[upon seeing where they are going to eat]
How beautiful!
How elegant!

[uneasily]
How much?
If you're going to spend the whole evening acting like a scared rabbit, maybe I'd better order some lettuce.
And what would you like, sir.
Six months off for good behavior.
I've never touched a woman before.
You still haven't. That's my corset.
Corneilius Hackl! What are you doing in New York?
Oh, I'm just delivering some oats.
Delivering some oats? With my former intended? You're discharged!
You can't fire me. I quit!
So do I!
Barnaby Tucker, you're discharged.
You can't fire me. I quit!
So do I!
I've worked hard and I've become rich and friendless and mean. In America, that's about as far as you can go.

[after Cornelius attempts a dance lesson from Dolly]
Oh, that's just absolutely wonderful, Mr. Hackl. When I think of the lucky women who'll find Heaven in your arms... I think we'll go back to Lesson One. Shall we?
